It’s simple: hungry students don’t learn. The Closing the College Hunger Gap Act would mandate that low-income students are notified of their SNAP eligibility when they apply for student aid.

I met with students, food pantry directors and college officials this spring, who told me something I was already familiar with from my experience in the classroom: food insecurity isn’t just a hunger problem- it is a threat to college completion.

The current stats are shocking: 
 
>2 million at-risk students potentially eligible for SNAP did not receive benefits.
>30% of UConn students report skipping meals.
>30% of undergrad ECSU students report being food insecure.

Food insecurity and hunger is a problem on CT college campuses, and we have not done enough to address it. That stops now. Today, I will introduce the Closing the College Hunger Gap Act with @ChrisMurphyCT to ensure college students are protected from food insecurity. pic.twitter.com/wvDvIkhFlb
